SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.managers

Class EnemyManager

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.managers.EnemyManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updateable
public class EnemyManager extends Object implements Updateable, Renderable
Manages the creation, lifespan, and behaviour of all enemies in the game. This class is responsible for spawning new enemies, updating their state, handling collisions with the player (Ali), and removing enemies that are no longer within the game boundaries. It triggers the HitFlashEffect on Ali upon collision.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemyManager

      public EnemyManager()
      Constructs an EnemyManager. Initializes the manager by clearing any existing enemies and setting the last enemy creation time to zero.

  • Method Details

    • getEnemies

      public Set<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Returns all active Enemy instances currently managed by this EnemyManager.
      Returns:
      A Set containing all active enemy entities.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • getEnemyCreationCooldownMs

      public long getEnemyCreationCooldownMs()
      Gets the cooldown time in milliseconds before a new enemy can be created.
      Returns:
      The cooldown time in milliseconds.

    • getLastEnemyCreationTime

      public long getLastEnemyCreationTime()
      Returns the timestamp (in milliseconds) of the last time an enemy was successfully created.
      Returns:
      The timestamp of the last enemy creation.

    • addEnemiesTest

      public void addEnemiesTest()
      A utility method for testing purposes to quickly add a small group of different enemy types to the game at random locations.

    • init

      public final void init()
      Initializes the EnemyManager for a new game. This method resets the random number generator, clears the list of active enemies, and sets the last enemy creation time to zero.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the set of currently managed enemies. This is typically called when starting a new game or resetting the game state.

    • canCreateEnemy

      public boolean canCreateEnemy()
      Checks if a new enemy can be created based on the maximum enemy count and the enemy creation cooldown.
      Returns:
      true if a new Enemy can be created, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • addEnemy

      public void addEnemy(Enemy enemy)
      Adds a specific Enemy instance to the set of managed enemies. This method also updates the last enemy creation time if the addition is successful and allowed by canCreateEnemy().
      Parameters:
      enemy - The new enemy to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • createRandomEnemy

      public void createRandomEnemy(Ali ali)
      Creates a new enemy of a random type at a random spawn point (if allowed by canCreateEnemy()) and adds it to the managed list of enemies. The newly created enemy will target the player (Ali).
      Parameters:
      ali - The player (Ali) that the created enemy will target.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the RUNNING state.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates all managed objects and the current game state. This includes attempting to create new enemies, updating the state of existing enemies, and checking for collisions. The hit flash effect for Ali is managed within the Ali class itself.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updateable

    • render

      public void render(Graphics2D g2d)
      Renders all currently active enemies on the provided Graphics2D context.
      Specified by:
      render in interface Renderable
      Parameters:
      g2d - The Graphics2D context to draw on.
